Portal 2 deixa o original parecer um jogo criado por uma empresa de fundo de quintal. Ele pega todas as qualidades do seu predecessor e expande sem deixar o jogo maçante ou descaracterizado, como acontece com diversas sequências. O novo modo co-op é surpreendetemente divertido, algo inesperado considerando a complexidade do jogo.

Jogo recomendadíssimo para qualquer um, seja você um fã do jogo original ou não.

Portal 2 is a big jump from Portal 1. Portal requires a lot of co-operative gameplay in the co-op game. Either you can help each other solve teh puzzle or kill each other which will get you NOWHERE >:D. Portal 2 has a bunch of new features and challenging puzzles to solve. High recommended game to get. Worth every cent you spent.

A truly great game that lives up to the Portal name. While I found the puzzles to be easier than the first Portal, the more expansive story brought my enjoyment level up to that of the original. GLaDOS remains one of my favorite fictional characters and the humor she brings to this game is spot-on. I highly recommend purchasing a copy of Portal 2.

Magnificent piece of work Valve made here with their last jewel. Portal was famous because of its innovative gameplay (with portals), Portal 2 is famous because of everything else. Both single and multiplayer campaigns are perfect.

Portal 2 is a big improvement over the first one. It is longer, even more clever, and to top it off, it has co-op that is also incredibly smart in it's way of presenting puzzles and utilizing you and your partners skills. I highly recommend if you were a fan of the first Portal.
A necessity for the pwners.
It's a really fun game, it's challenging enough where you are stuck for a little while but after you solve the puzzle you feel like a genuis.
best game ever
Absolute Brilliance and Perfection
This game is by far one of the best I have played. Story, feel, humour, innovation. It is all there. Try out Portal 1 before.

One of the best games of all time in my opinion, thinking with portals is a great way to challenge yourself while enjoying a rich, detailed story.

Pros-
Great story
Brilliant voice acting
Plot twists
Well thought out levels for both single player and multiplayer
Custom map support

Cons-
The single player story could be a bit longer, but the co-op more than makes up for this
The source engine does look a bit dated now, although still impressive for an older engine.
Its overall fun factor is well far beyond description!

Instant classic. Continues the Portal story w/ great humor, visuals, and gameplay in what you'd expect from top developer/publusher Valve.
I beat both the co-op and single player campaighns and they were awesome
Good solid game with clever level design, nice puzzles and superb voice acting.
If the question is "To buy or not" - the answer is "To buy".
Puzzles aren't as good as the first but, there are some nice new mechanics. It's a great game and much longer.
coop rules

This is one of the greatest games ever.  Valve one upped themselves on the last game.  The story is phenomenal, the game play great, and the characters are just so  awesome and inspire so many emotions.  

My only hang up is that it wasn't that hard, nor was it as long as i wanted.  Then again, including coop, I got about 25 hours of play out of this game.  I just wish that the end puzzles had been more challenging.  Portal 1s later game puzzles were more difficult than these.

But this is definitely one of the greats.  Its up there with HL2, Zelda, and a few other select games.  It will always have a place in my heart.  

Buy it now, for the story and characters if nothing else.  The story of Portal and HL2 and the entire HL2 universe is worth more than their lengths.  The story is what sucks me into all of Valve's releases; Valve has made me laugh, cry, frown, smile and just about every other emotion that is possible on a humans emotional palette.

It's funny, it's clever, it makes you feel clever; it's great fun.
If you really want to hear my in-depth thoughts, check out: http://www.jrtshow.com/review/portal-2/
J'suis dans l'espaaaaaaace !
Portal 2 is amazing and is definately worth your money, the new co-op feature was a great idea and is lots of fun! 10/10

When I first heard that Valve was going to make a sequeal to Portal, I was puzzled. "How does one make a sequeal to such a short, fun and genre-defining game?" i asked. Valve's responce was "Like this!" and showed me Portal 2.

Portal 2 is THE perfect game sequeal. The comedy is spot on, the game-play is perfect, I love this game so much, I played it's single player twice in the same week.

There's only 2 problems I have with P2. Firstly the music, the music is the 1st Portal made you felt like you was alone in the test chambers, no sign of life. The music in P2 is wonderful, don't get me wrong, but I don't get that same feeling of lonelyness I got in the last game due to it.
Second problem, no references to cakes. It was a stample of the first game, why didn't they carry it to the second?

To conclude, buy both Portal and Portal 2 - YOU'RE MISSING OUT!
une tuerie  !

Great game, or greatest game?

... But seriously, it's pretty good. I don't know if I'd rank it as "ZOMG GREATEST OF ALL TIME!" or something like that, but it's definitely up there. There are fewer portal-able surfaces compared to the first one make the game much easier then the original. The second act however feels a bit too long. It's all much too massive and even fewer surfaces to stick a portal onto.

The storyline is top notch though, and the co-op alone is definitely worth the price of admission alone. It's best to play co-op with someone else who hasn't finished it yet otherwise you'll get some dude bossing you around or some guy getting fed up with you really quickly.

In short, play it.
Isane. Best graphics ever. Gripping storyline. All in all, 5 stars.

Portal 2 is essentially every bit as good as the first game in the series, and yet that seems to leave it somehow a little short of the original in terms of resonance and overall impact.

While Portal 2 as a whole is an excellent and rather unforgettable experience, it doesn't deviate far from the original at all. The gels definitely add a new dimension to the gameplay, but not a great deal and only to about 1/3 of the whole game. As a collection of puzzles, Portal 2 feels significantly easier than Portal. Many times I found that the goal of a puzzle was not necessarily to find a clever solution, but simply to understand what the very simple but slightly obtuse solution was.

Co-op is another story. It changes the game almost entirely and is very fun to play. However, it, almost moreso than the single player campaign, lacks replay value. This is because playing with a partner whose skill level doesn't match yours can be frustrating, regardless of which side of the equation you're on.
If you don't enjoy Portal 2, chances are that I don't care for you as a human.
SPAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACE! AWESOME GAME!
One of the best games ever made, and one of Valve finest job. A MUST HAVE in every single Steam account.

Wonderfully entertaining, full of humour, challenges and potatoes.

Even not considering from the Potato ARG pre-release madness, Portal 2 turned out to be a lot of fun. I remember thinking to myself about a 1/4 through the game - "This is going to end too quickly, this isn't fair!" Then the game took a turn for the very interesting. Portal 2 unveils the secrets behind Apeture Science and the infamous "GlaDoS" (you know, the one you "murdered" in Portal?). The Co-op is fun, but if the option to have community developed maps existed, it would be even more fun. I feel a little jipped on the multiplayer side. But all in all, a great game. (4/5)

Great sequel to an epic game.  Play it.
I could tell you more, but it's much better that you go and experience it.  Play "Portal" first (it'll only take 6 hours or so)  and then play this.  
Do it.  
Do it now.

A very worthy successor to one of the best games ever made. Longer, funnier, better production values - and more portals!  No cake, though, just potatoes.  Cannot recommend highly enough, but only if you've already played through (and enjoyed!) the first Portal game.  It's worth playing them both in order.  Plus, if you're interested in the plot, read the connecting comic which is set between the games (available for free on the Web or in 'Extras' from Portal 2's main menu).
Portal 2 is a worthy successor to the first game, and has a great story and brilliant writing.
Great game. Rated A+++++ oh wait, this isn't ebay.

There are a lot of great things about this game; it feels much deeper and more alive than the original, the storyline is excellent, and the progression of puzzles and new tools is spot on, keeping them fun yet challenging.  

In fact, I can only think of one thing that would keep my from purchasing it again, and its something the original portal suffered from too: it's just too short.  The whole thing, single player, co-op, and developer commentary, only yields maybe 20 - 25 hours at best.

I'm sure there will be custom content and perhaps expansions down the road but, at the moment I feel $50 just isn't enough bang for the buck.  Still a load of fun though.

Honestly. Humor of the quality you'll want to replay it several times over.  Creative puzzles. and the Achievements require dedicated thought, rather than hours of repetition. Co-op is an amazing way to strengthen your relationship with someone, or ruin it forever. I can not recommend this enough.
GET IT
I Like Portal 2!

One of my favorite single-player experiences of all time. The Portal universe is just amazing. So much humor in this game, I laughed out loud on multiple occasions. Found myself puzzled at times, it's not the hardest game in the world, but there will be a slight challenge for everyone. 

This has got to be one of the most well-written games I've played, proving that video games really can be an art. Storyline is average length (about 6-8 hours) and about four hours of co-op gameplay, which is a fantastic addition. 

Definitely play through the first in the series before getting this. I will gift you Portal 1 if you message me. Only gripe with Portal 2 is the effing hat store. Fortunately, these items are purely aesthetic. This alone is not at all a reason for disliking the game, though, it does not affect gameplay at all. Buy this now, even if you aren't a fan of puzzles!
Co-op makes it worth it. So awesome.

Awesome, awesome game. Loved Portal 1, and they did all the good stuff here. The single player builds on to the 1st's story, and co-op is just such brilliant fun. The script is genius.

A thinking person's FPS. Love it.
